title: A question about Runes
body: Are there any champions that share the same runes?

replies.body: you should have ad, ap, tank pages by default, usable by any and every1, then the other pages are modified to suit certain games

The thing is, I don't think it is possible to modify runes during gameplay, unlike masteries.
After I done a few research just now, I found that Lux and Aurelion Sol can use the same runes, but that's all I know.
What I do know is that a few fighters have similar runes, but not exactly the same, for example, Fiora and Irelia both share runes, but not all the same.

Fiora's runes
9x Greater mark of attack damage
9x Greater Glyph of magic resist
9x Greater Seal of Armor
3x Greater Quintessence of attack damage

Irelia's runes
9x Greater Mark of Attack Damage
9x Greater Glyph of Magic Resist
9x Greater Seal of Amour
3x Greater Quintessence of attack speed

As you can see from above, these two has pretty much the same runes, but not completely the same.
Will only one of those runes be enough for both of them, or do they absolutely have to use separate runes?

Irelia should be 
6x Greater Glyph of Magic Resist
3x Greater Glyph of Scaling Magic Resist

Lets take irelia, fiora and yasuo

Irelia:
9x Greater Mark of Attack Damage
9x Greater Glyph of Magic Resist
9x Greater Glyph of Scaling Magic Resist
9x Greater Seal of Amour
3x Greater Quintessence of Attack Speed

Fiora:
9x Greater mark of attack damage
9x Greater Glyph of magic resist
9x Greater Seal of Armor
3x Greater Quintessence of attack damage

Yasuo:
9x Greater Mark of Attack speed
9x Greater Glyph of Magic Resist
9x Greater Seal of Amour
3x Greater Quintessence of Attack Speed

Although yasuo flows best with both attack speed quins and marks, he can use both the fiora and irelia runes. 

Though, if you wish to have a rune set which runs between then both, you would want to take irelia's rune set, as it is the average between them all. 

Take yasuo, he does flow best with full attackspeed, but this is also not always the best set to take, versus things like malz, he would want to take full attack damage runes, otherwise he will lose the trades, while versus something like garen, he would want irelia's set, and something such as Cassiopeia, where you need to move around to avoid her w and stack up your tornado quickly you would want attackspeed. 

Runes for champs change depending on their match ups, but it is best to have 3 base sets, as they are a median for all champs, meaning that every champ can use them, might not be the best option, but it also isn't the worse (like full aa speed on a garen)

Fighter
9x Greater Mark of Attack Damage
6x Greater Glyph of Magic Resist
3x Greater Glyph of Scaling Magic Resist
9x Greater Seal of Amour
3x Greater Quintessence of attack speed

Mage
9x Greater Mark of Magic/Hybrid Penetration
3x Greater Glyph of Scaling Magic Resist
3x Greater Glyph of Magic resist
3x Greater Glyph of Scaling Ability Power
3x Greater Seal of Amour
6x Greater Seal of Scaling Health
3x Greater Quintessence of Ability Power

Tank
9x Greater Mark of Attack Damage
3x Greater Glyph of Magic Resist
6x Greater Glyph of Scaling Magic Resist
9x Greater Seal of Amour
3x Greater Quintessence of Armour

The magic resist runes are split up like that as they provide sufficient resistance for the champion to scale, at level 6, the runes pay off with higher magic resist than a flat rune will give. A mage does favour the ability power too, as they usually spike at level 6, which is where they out scale flat ap runes, they also do prefer a health/armour mix. And tanks are straightforward, they like to sit on you and tank, a little extra power to help last hit doesn't hurt either, also gives slightly more kill potential, the 25 or whatever armor you get from the Quints and Seals is more than enough to cover you, they do also prefer scaling mr as they start with a reasonably high magic resist anyway.

> Just for those who disagree with full aa speed, yes it doesn't do the most damage, but it provides him more utility and if you have 2-3 points in q at lv4 it will out damage due to the full second reduction (it reduces it to like 2.89, or did since last time played) it gives on his q. It's jsut a safer pick overall for him against poke lanes, as it allows him to poke back with more of a positive outcome, and when you get crit its higher damage for more poke.

Thanks for your suggestion.
I already set up the runes for Irelia, which worked quite well.

Rune pages work pretty much the same as Masteries. They will all 'work' on any champ, but there are 'optimal' builds for each.

In your Fiora/Irelia example, Fiora's runes will work on Irelia, but it might not be 'optimal'.

Runes allow you to adjust the champion stats to suit your play style, but you generally want to augment their strengths. Fiora has built in attack speed so would benefit from more AD, while Irelia would benefit from attack speed.

Having rune pages for each champion is not essential and a very expensive exercise (which I think is too expensive and out dated). So, first concentrate on building generic pages (like other people have suggested) by buying the runes that are on sale. Then use those pages to augment the champ you play as best you can. It may not be 'optimal', but it will still work.

Hope this helps.

There are generic rune pages which work over archetypes (ADCs, mid AP mages, tanky top laner). The most variation exists for junglers since they need different stats to clear.

If you want a more in depth look at rune pages in general you can check out Phreak's guide (might be a little out-dated but his reasoning is still worth hearing): http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/Mbfq2QsO-phreaks-guide-to-runes-for-season-5-2015
